epiviz 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Age Sex Pyramid

    agesex_pyramid.Rd

    Age Sex Pyramid

    agesex_pyramid(
  df,
  colours = c("#440154", "#fde725"),
  x_breaks = 20,
  y_title = "Proportion of People Percentage (%)",
  text_size = 12,
  conf_limits = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    df

    Data frame which has the following columns with names given below age: char type>> age group can be given as ranges (e.g. "0-4","5-18", "19-64", "65+") sex: char type>> must be coded as "Female" and "Male" value: num type>> numerical value used for pyramid (can be proportion or cases) Optional (set conf_limits parameter to TRUE if error bars are required): lowercl: num type>> lower confidence limits for value uppercl: num type>> upper confidence limits for value

    colours

    List of colours for the genders in HEX format in the order Female, Male Default values for parameter: c("#003B5C", "#007C91")

    x_breaks

    Number of ticks on X axis (default is 20)

    y_title

    Title that appears on the X axis in as a string

    text_size

    Text size can be modified by providing this number (default set to 15)

    conf_limits

    Boolean variable (True - if error bars are required). If set to True: the data frame should include the lowercl and uppercl columns

    Value

    Returns an age-sex pyramid as a ggplot object

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
# Example 1. Simplest use (defaults):
 agesex_pyramid(data_frame)

# Example 2. Usage with parameters

agesex_pyramid(data_frame,
               colours= c("#440154", "#fde725"),
               x_breaks = 20,
               y_title = "Proportion of People Percentage (%)",
               text_size = 15,
               conf_limits = FALSE)
}
